intro: Vanhouttea calcarata, commonly known as the rock almond, is a tropical shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
